name: Highly Effective
description: The protection and management system under implementation is effective and able to maintain the site’s values and integrity. Aspects of site management can be regarded as being best-practice.

name: Effective
description: The protection and management system under implementation is adequate and is likely to essentially maintain the site’s values and integrity over the medium-term. However, it may be insufficient to maintain the site’s values and integrity over the long-term.

name: Some Concern
description: The protection and management system is not fully addressing the threats to the site’s values, resulting in a number of conservation issues. However, these issues could be reversed and effectively addressed in the short-term if management capacity and/or protection are improved.

name: Serious Concern
description: The protection and management system shows major deficiencies and is unable to maintain the site’s values and integrity over the short or long-term. Major interventions are required to enhance management capacity and/or protection.

name: Data Deficient
description: Available evidence is insufficient to draw a conclusion.
